content.description:
a variety of fun top ropes from 5.5 to 5.11. multiple TR anchors. see pic.

does anyone have any info on these? If so, please post. I can add the individual routes.
content.protection: You can easily walk to top to set up ropes. No need to extend the anchors. Routes are short. Gym rope would suffice.
content.location: Approx 100 ft climbers left of Crank Start Crack. 30-40 feet from the road.

content.description: Straight forward route. Climb up the face and onto the nose of the rock. Good exposure at the end of the climb.
content.protection: 5 bolts, bring a #3 cam and some small gear if you dont want to run it out. Two bolt rap station on top.
content.location: Right of the road less than a 1/4 mile up from New Directions.

content.description: An enjoyable slightly overhanging crack. Crux is the first couple of moves. Perfect hand jams, if only it were longer...
content.location: Located above and to the left of The One minute walk. Scrabble up the gully to the left of "The one minute rock" head to the base of the obivous crack. Have at it!

content.description: Crank Start Crack (aka Kern Crank Start) is a good, but short crack that is right off the road. The crux is right off the ground. Its location makes it a good quick stop when heading up river.
content.protection: Pro .5" to 2". Bolts on top can be accessed from behind to set up a top rope.
content.location: Directly across the street from Chico Flat. Look for  the sign on the left side of the road, a couple hundred yards past the parking area for the New Directions cluster. There is a tree growing directly right of the crack that keeps it relatively shaded a lot of the time.
